Name: The Survival Framework - How They Take It, How You Stop It
Lessons: fake-wallets-look-alike-apps; pump-and-dump-coordinated-hype; icos-presales-with-unrealistic-promises; fake-exchanges-withdrawal-traps; cloud-mining-hands-off-yield-rackets; unsolicited-opportunities-email-dm; shillers-social-manipulation; mlm-referral-pyramids; fake-endorsements-deepfake-promos; ransomware-extortion; fraudulent-investment-dashboards; impersonation-fake-support; social-media-giveaway-doubler-cons; malware-in-portfolio-price-tracker-apps
Short description: Most coins aren’t lost in trades — they’re stolen. Learn the tricks behind scams and the habits that stop them.
Course descrition:
Most crypto isn’t lost in trades. It’s taken. Not by volatility, but by design.
Through polished dashboards, “official” apps, fake endorsements, and countdowns that force your hand. Scams don’t look like scams until after you’ve signed - and then it’s too late. Once you give up a seed, an approval, or a deposit, it’s gone. No undo. No appeal.

This course pulls back the curtain on how those traps are built, why they work on smart people, and what to watch for before you click. You’ll see the patterns across every scam - wallets, hype groups, miracle yields, deepfakes, fake exchanges - and you’ll learn the checks that break them all.

Skip it, and every login, every trade, every click is a roll of the dice.
Take it, and you carry habits that make you unreadable to scammers. The hook lands on others. Not on you.

What You’ll Learn (to see traps before they close):

  • Spot the fakes - wallets, dashboards, and exchanges built to drain you the second you click “approve.”
  • Cut through the hype - how coordinated pumps and fake endorsements push you to buy the top and hold the bag.
  • See the payout trap - the “unlock fees” and “miracle yields” that only pay until your deposit is gone.
  • Defend your keys - why every scam aims at your seed phrase or approval - and the habits that keep both locked.
  • Use quick tests, not trust - small deposits, verified links, and cross-checks that expose scams in minutes.

‍

What you gain isn’t just safety - it’s armor: scams lose their edge, pressure loses its grip, and your habits outlast the tricks.
Author: Cypher Funk

Name: The Door to Crypto - Safe Wallets and First Steps
Short description: Learn how to set up a wallet safely, move your first funds, and make a trade you can actually verify.
Course descrition:
You don’t start in crypto by chasing profits - you start by protecting yourself.

This course gives you the practical footing to move from reading about crypto to actually using it. You’ll choose how you want to hold your keys, install a wallet from the official page, and set your ceiling so mistakes never grow larger than you can handle. Then you’ll take your first safe step: moving a small amount from an exchange into your own wallet, and confirming it on-chain. Finally, you’ll complete one honest trade - a tiny swap you can explain, verify, and clean up by revoking the window you opened.‍

What You’ll Learn (to start safe and scale later):

  • Custody & temperature: If you don’t know who really holds the key - or whether it’s safe or exposed - you’ll find out the hard way when access disappears.
  • Installing safely: Miss the official source once, and you could hand your keys to a fake. You’ll learn the simple habit that blocks this trap.
  • Crossing the on-ramp: Sending funds without checking is how beginners lose them. Here you’ll practice the safe path: deposit → buy small → withdraw → confirm.
  • Protective habits: Shared laptops, random extensions, seed words typed online - all rookie mistakes. You’ll set habits that stop them before they cost you.
  • Your first trade, done cleanly: Most newcomers swap, then leave approvals wide open. You’ll learn to see the receipt on-chain and close the window you opened.

‍

What you gain isn’t just a wallet - it’s a routine that keeps mistakes tiny, builds habits you can trust, and scales later without changing anything but the zeros.
Author: Cypher Funk

Name: The System Beneath the Hype - Blockchain & Value
Short description: Stop guessing what crypto headlines mean — learn how blockchains, tokens, and digital dollars actually work.
Course descrition:
Every crypto system runs on hidden rules - miss them, and you’ll pay in confusion, fake pages, and $1 that won’t move when it matters.

This course gives you the foundation most people skip. You’ll see how blockchains actually keep order, why tokens exist at all, and how stablecoins hold (or lose) their $1 when stress hits. You’ll learn to read consensus for what it is - rules everyone can check - and to spot when “control” still hides in the code.

What You’ll Learn (to know the rules beneath the price):

  • Ledgers: If you can’t read the ledger yourself, you’ll end up trusting screenshots and dashboards that can lie. You’ll learn how blockchains make edits costly and obvious.
  • Consensus: Without it, you’ll never know if a transaction really “stuck.” You’ll see how networks agree on order and why finality matters.
  • Tokens: Skip the rules in code, and you’ll buy coins with hidden levers. You’ll learn how supply, rights, and control are actually enforced.
  • Stablecoins: If you don’t know what holds $1 in place, you won’t see when it’s about to slip. You’ll learn how they behave in calm - and under stress.

‍

What you gain isn’t just knowledge - it’s the ability to see the rails yourself and stop donating money to mistakes others already made.
Author: Cypher Funk

Name: The Invisible Systems That Shape Your Life
Short description: A course about the systems you already depend on — and how blockchains expose their hidden rules before they break.
Course descrition:
You don’t see systems by looking at headlines — you see them by tracing the rails underneath.

This course gives you the foundation to read the invisible structures that govern value, identity, and trust in the digital age. You’ll learn how a vote can be treated like a transaction, how memory can survive disaster, how health records can move without losing control, and how a label on a product can finally mean what it says. Each step shows you not the hype, but the mechanism: rules that hold or fail when stress hits.

What You’ll Learn (and avoid paying for later):

  • Democracy on ledgers: If a ballot can’t be verified independently, it can be rewritten quietly. You’ll learn how blockchains make elections transparent, auditable, and harder to steal.
  • Identity that doesn’t wash away: Floods, fires, or corruption shouldn’t erase who you are. You’ll see how public records anchored on-chain create memory that outlives paper.
  • Health data with boundaries: When systems don’t talk, patients pay the price. You’ll learn how decentralized records give access without surrendering control.
  • Markets that prove themselves: Labels and supply chains often lie. You’ll see how blockchains stamp every step, so proof replaces slogans.

What you gain isn’t just knowledge — it’s the ability to look at everyday systems and ask: Who controls the record? Who checks the proof? Who holds the lever when stress arrives?
Descriiption:
This isn’t about buying crypto.
It’s about understanding the systems that shape your daily life — and how blockchain is quietly starting to change them.

Whether you’re reading a product label, renewing your passport, or applying for benefits abroad —
what’s recorded matters.
What can be verified matters more.

This course gives you the tools to see where trust breaks down — and where technology can restore it.

Because when you understand how decentralized systems work,
you start to spot what others miss.
You become harder to fool.
And more able to choose what you support.

Name: Market Architect - Blueprint Beats Hype
Lessons: liquidity-what-holds-and-what-breaks; volume-the-weight-of-attention; market-stability-what-holds-before-it-moves; market-capitalization-what-it-is-and-why-it-matters; real-supply-whats-actually-in-play; slippage-the-friction-of-execution; the-hidden-cost-of-movement; unshaken
Short description: Most traders only see candles. You’ll see what really matters—whether the market can carry your trade or collapse under it.
Course descrition:
Most traders look at price and miss the system beneath it. That’s why they get surprised when markets slip, stall, or collapse.

This course shows you how to read the market as an architect - not a spectator. You’ll learn how liquidity, volume, and stability actually hold price in place. You’ll see how market cap and real supply change the weight of every move. You’ll understand why slippage and fees reveal the truth about structure, and you’ll build the resilience to hold your ground when volatility tests you.

What You’ll Learn (to see beneath price):

  • Liquidity: How to tell if a market can handle your trade - or if even small moves will break it.
  • Volume: How to read whether price moves are backed by real participation or just drifting on hope.
  • Stability: How to use quiet ranges as signals of stored energy, not wasted time.
  • Market cap: How size shapes behavior - fast sparks in small caps, slow weight in large ones.
  • Real supply: How to see what tokens are actually in play, and when unlocks or insiders can break structure.
  • Execution: How to read slippage and fees as signals of fragility or design, not just costs.
  • Resilience: How to build routines that keep you steady when volatility hits.

‍

What you gain isn’t prediction - it’s structure. A framework that shows you when the market is strong enough to trust, fragile enough to avoid, and exactly how to adapt before pressure turns into loss.

Name: Read Charts Like a Map: Trade With a Plan, Not a Guess.
Short description: Most traders stare at charts and guess. You’ll read them like a map—so every trade has a reason, a plan, and a way out.
Course descrition:
Most people stare at charts and guess. They chase moves, buy too late, sell too early, and have no idea where they’re wrong. Without a system, every trade feels random - more like gambling than learning. And when you can’t explain why you entered or exited, you can’t improve.

This course shows you how to read a chart like a map: where a move can continue, where it’s likely to pause or reverse, and when you should act - or wait. You’ll use simple, repeatable checks so every trade has a reason to enter, a place to exit, and a clear “I’m wrong here” line.

What You’ll Learn (without the expensive mistakes)

  • Find the Real Move (Direction & Strength)
    How to tell if the market is truly moving one way or just wobbling. No more chasing random spikes - you’ll act only when the move is real.
  • Draw the Lines That Count (Support, Resistance & Setups)
    How to mark the levels that count, pick entry spots with a reason, set honest stops, and plan exits before you click.
  • Spot When It’s Real (Volatility & Volume)
    How to see if a move has weight behind it or if it’s just noise. You’ll learn when to trade with confidence, when to size down, and when to stay out.
  • A Routine You Can Trust
    Replace impulsive trades with a simple checklist. Wait for signs to align, act with purpose, and know when to stand aside.
  • Mistakes That Don’t Repeat
    Build habits that stop the classic errors: chasing late, moving stops, overtrading, and holding when the market already turned.

‍

Why this matters - Instead of guessing, you’ll have a clear routine: mark levels → wait for alignment → size to conditions → exit on plan. The noise becomes a map. The chart makes sense. And your trades start to feel deliberate instead of lucky.

Name: The Survival Framework - Risk Rules That Hold
Short description: Learn the rules that keep bad weeks small, protect against leaks, and make your gains last.
Course descrition:
Markets don’t blow up accounts. Structures do - or the lack of them.
This course turns “I hope this works” into rules you can run on tired days and bad weeks.

You’ll stop guessing which coins “diversify” you and actually map the plumbing behind them. You’ll build trades in steps with clear invalidation and real reward-to-risk. You’ll size positions by formula so three losses aren’t a wipeout, and you’ll rebalance on a schedule so winners don’t drift you into danger. You’ll also learn simple protection moves before/after shocks - and how to measure results in R so you know, not hope.

What You’ll Learn (to turn risk into routine):

  • Real diversification (by pipes, not tickers): If your “five coins” share chain/treasury/venue, one shock hits them all. You’ll map the plumbing and cap any single pipe.
  • Trade building that survives randomness: One entry + one hope = avoidable losses. Use cadence and ladders, set invalidation, and aim for reward that actually pays for risk.
  • Position size by formula, not feel: Guessing size turns three small losses into a wipeout. Risk a fixed dollar amount per idea so red weeks stay small.
  • Balance that doesn’t drift into danger: Winners creep, weights bloat, then one drop dents the whole account. Rebalance on a schedule with simple tolerance bands.
  • Protection before and after shocks: Ignoring events or leaving unlimited approvals open is how accounts leak. Plan around scheduled news and close windows you don’t need.
  • Measure in R (so you know, not hope): Track risk vs. reward so “good weeks” actually add up over time.

‍

What you gain isn’t just safety - it’s a keel: bad weeks stay small, good weeks don’t make you fragile, and your rules outlast your mood.

Name: What a Token Really Is
Lessons: the-essence-of-the-token; price-and-the-illusion-of-value; supply-scarcity-or-scripted-theater; immutability-and-the-levers-of-control; governments-exits-and-the-power-to-choke; tokens-vs-money-stocks-bonds-and-gold; the-paradox-at-the-core
Short description: Never buy a token you don’t understand again. Because the real risk isn’t price — it’s ignorance of the rules behind it.
Course descrition:
Most people talk about tokens like magic objects — as if price explains value, supply guarantees scarcity, and “blockchain” means freedom. It doesn’t.

Tokens aren’t coins in a vault. They’re rules written into ledgers — rules that can protect you, trap you, or quietly drain you depending on who still holds the lever.

This course strips away slogans and walks you through what a token actually is — not as hype, but as structure. And it does it through a guided dialogue between Lucia, the learner who keeps asking the uncomfortable questions, and Eunha, the mind who refuses to answer with slogans. The format isn’t a lecture. It’s a dissection — one question at a time, until the illusions break.

You’ll learn where tokens live, who controls them, how price really forms, how supply is created or faked, where immutability breaks, and why governments can’t kill them but can choke them at the exits. You’ll stop treating tokens like lottery tickets and start seeing them as systems: code, power, belief, and design.

‍

What You’ll Learn (not to trade tokens — but to finally understand them)
‍

  • The Ledger, Not the App: Tokens don’t live in wallets or exchanges. They exist only as entries in a shared ledger across thousands of nodes — your wallet just proves you can move them.
  • Price as Agreement, Not Truth: Tokens don’t contain value. Price is just the last trade — shaped by belief, liquidity, and manipulation, not by “intrinsic worth.”
  • Supply: Scarcity or Theater: Fixed caps, mint functions, burns, elastic models — you’ll learn how to tell the difference between real scarcity and supply staged for marketing.
  • Immutability: The Marketing vs. the Mechanic: Blockchains are hard to rewrite. Tokens are not. Admin keys, proxy upgrades, pausable contracts — you’ll learn how “decentralized” something really is.
  • Governments, Exits, and the Control Layer: States can’t delete blockchains, but they can pressure the rails: banks, exchanges, payment processors. You’ll learn where tokens resist and where they suffocate.
  • Tokens vs. Money, Stocks, Bonds, and Gold: What tokens borrow from legacy assets — and what they never inherit: legal rights, enforceable claims, or physical scarcity.
  • The Paradox at the Core: How tokens can be both real and illusion — enforced by code, priced by belief, and fought over by power. And why that tension is the point, not the flaw.

‍

What you gain isn’t “crypto confidence.” What you gain is a lens that doesn’t break when the market does.
Author: Cypher Funk
